details.title: A Censored Sequential Posterior Odd Test (SPOT) Method for Verification of the Mean Time To Repair
details.standardTitle: A Censored Sequential Posterior Odd Test (SPOT) Method for Verification of the Mean Time To Repair

p: Bo Guo is a professor in the School of Information Systems & Management at the National University of Defense Technology. Dr. Guo received his Ph.D. (1999) in industrial management and engineering, from the Science University of Tokyo. His research majors in reliability system engineering, maintenance engineering, integrated support information system, system programming, and project management.

authors.affiliation: Sch. of Inf. Syst. & Manage., Nat. Univ. of Defense Technol., Changsha
authors.name: Bo Guo

p: Ping Jiang is a Ph.D. candidate in the School of Information Systems & Management at the National University of Defense Technology. He received his Master Degree (2002) in Management Science and Engineering from the National University of Defense Technology, and a B.S. (1999) in Applied Mathematics from the National University of Defense Technology. His research areas are reliability, maintainability, and evaluation.

authors.affiliation: Sch. of Inf. Syst. & Manage., Nat. Univ. of Defense Technol., Changsha
authors.name: Ping Jiang

p: Yun-Yan Xing is a Ph.D. candidate in the School of Information Systems & Management at the National University of Defense Technology. She received her Master Degree (2005) in Control Science and Engineering from the National University of Defense Technology. Her research areas are reliability improvement, and evaluation.

authors.affiliation: Sch. of Inf. Syst. & Manage., Nat. Univ. of Defense Technol., Changsha
authors.name: Yun-Yan Xing

details.abstract: The verification of the Mean Time To Repair (MTTR) is a problem of interest in many practical cases. As maintenance time can often be adequately described by a lognormal distribution, the problem leads us to research on statistical inference on the mean of the lognormal distribution. To achieve this purpose, we propose the Sequential Posterior Odd Test (SPOT) method for verification of the unknown parameter of the lognormal distribution. We first present a model to determine a threshold in the SPOT method for verification of MTTR. Moreover, the Censored SPOT method is proposed when the sample size (usually small) is fixed. A numeric example with comparison is discussed to illustrate advantages of the Censored SPOT method.

kwd: censored sequential posterior odd test method

links.abstract: A Bayes approach is used to test the equality of two reliability functions when the underlying distributions of the times-to-failure are lognormal. Using the method of moments it is found that a normal approximation of the posterior distribution of the threshold parameter is better than an approximation based on the Student t-distribution. Analytic foundations of the conclusions are provided.
